subtitle: Eight-Organ Creative-Institutional System
system_summary: VERITAS II — 97 repos (all on GitHub), 87 ACTIVE + 10 ARCHIVED, 9 flagship repos with full community health files, 41 essays (~150K words), CLAUDE.md across all active repos (100% AI-augmented workflow coverage), community health files inherited org-wide via 8 .github repos, POSSE distribution live, Jekyll site with RSS, 82+ CI/CD workflows, Astro portfolio site with 19 curated projects, 5 application packages, system-metrics.json dashboard, ~410K+ total words. Methodology: process-as-product, solo production at institutional scale, AI tools used as compositional instruments.
strategic_context: The eight-organ system coordinates 97 repos across 8 orgs with automated governance, dependency validation, and a promotion state machine. 41 essays document the methodology in real-time. Evidence supports applications across: (1) AI systems engineering roles (production-grade governance, autonomous infrastructure), (2) Creative/technical grants (sustained organizational capacity, process-as-product), (3) Technology residencies and fellowships (documented creative methodology).
supporting_evidence: Artists like Julian Oliver, Nicky Case, and Hundred Rabbits (Devine Lu Linvega & Rekka Bellum) treat protocols and governance structures as primary artistic output, demonstrating that small-scale sustainable creative infrastructure with extensive documentation receives institutional recognition (updated per 08-CANONICAL-ACTION-PLAN.md §7). Programs like Knight Foundation Art+Tech Expansion Fund, Processing Foundation Fellowship, Google Creative Fellowship explicitly evaluate infrastructure contribution and organizational capacity.
strategic_opportunity: Position the eight-organ system as evidence of: (a) production-ready thinking (hiring), (b) long-term digital capacity and sustainability (grants), (c) community contribution and reusable infrastructure (residencies). All organs launch simultaneously to demonstrate integrated systems thinking.

application_targets.description: Orchestration capacity, architectural reasoning, multi-agent systems
NSF, NEA, Mellon, Knight Foundation — infrastructure as art
Eyebeam, Recurse Center — equitable systems, community infrastructure
Processing Foundation, Google Creative — creative-technical practice with documented methodology
